title: India - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, members of Mottock Yuva Chatra Sanmilan and Chutia Chatra Sanstha, student organizations, staged a blockade on the road in Dibrugarh (Assam) after a student was reportedly hit by a vehicle, to protest against rash driving and demanded free treatment for the injured. [size=no report]
AJYCP: Asom Jatiyatabadi Yuva Chatra Parishad; Students (India)

On 5 February 2021, members of The Asom Jatiyatabadi Yuba Chatra Parishad (AJYCP) staged a protest at Doom Dooma (Assam) against the rise in price of petrol, diesel and other lubricants. They also burnt the effigies of Prime Minister of India and the Chief Minister and Union Petroleum Minister of the State. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, leaders and members of BJM staged a protest in Jamshedpur city (East Singhbhum, Jharkhand), against a builder, whose project is allegedly causing accumulation of dirty water. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, lawyers staged a protest, in Chandigarh (Chandigarh), against the three farm laws passed by the central government. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, physically challenged persons protested at Jammu city (Jammu and Kashmir) to demand implementation of disabilities acts 2016 in the state. [size=no report]
Shiv Sena; JWAM: Jammu West Assembly Movement; Labour Group (India)

On 5 February 2021, a large number of traders and JWAM members and dozens of Shiv Sena members protested at Jammu city (Jammu and Kashmir) against the increased prices of LPG, petrol and diesel. [size=large]

On 5 February 2021, migrants from the Talwara camp held a protest at Reasi area (Jammu and Kashmir) against the government to demand better facilities at Talwara colony and treatment at par with Kashmiri migrants. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, members of Kiyamgei Khoirom Leikai Meira Paibi, a women's organisation and Coalition Against Drugs and Alcohol (CADA) staged a sit in protest at Kyamgei Khoirom (coded as Keirao Bitra, Imphal East district, Manipur) demanding the government to move the drug haul case of 2018 to a higher court for reinvestigation. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, a large number of retired non-gazetted police personnel protested at Jammu city (Jammu and Kashmir) against the pay anomaly and discrimination in promotion. [size=large]
On 5 February 2021, scores of family members of a deceased woman protested at Srinagar city (Jammu and Kashmir) to demand justice against the alleged murder by her in-laws. [size=scores]
On 5 February 2021, students and locals protested at Ramnagar city (Udhampur district, Jammu and Kashmir) to demand that the school building be repaired. [size=no report]
Dalit Caste Group (India); SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India
On 5 February 2021, members of the SDPI and a Dalit group held a protest in Mysuru city (Mysuru, Karnataka) against the splashing of ink by an advocate on a well know professor. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, medical employees protested at Pallanwala town (Jammu district, Jammu and Kashmir) to demand DPC for all categories, pending salary and amendment of SRO-20 amidst the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, the government restored high speed internet services across Jammu and Kashmir coded at Srinagar city (Jammu and Kashmir) almost one and a half years after restrictions were placed, article 370 was abrogated and the state was bifurcated into two union territories.
On 5 February 2021, locals protested at Ghagwal block (Samba district, Jammu and Kashmir) against the water department over supplying muddy water in the area. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, over 100 students staged a protest on the campus of BBMKU in Dhanbad city (Jharkhand), for being denied admission to the university. [size=over 100]
Labour Group (India); TDP: Telugu Desam Party

On 5 February 2021, members of various trade unions and TDP held protests across Visakhapatnam city (Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh) against the plans of the Central government to privatize a steel plant. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, Dharmarth trust priests and employees held a massive protest at Jammu city (Jammu and Kashmir) to demand reconstitution of the Shrine Board. [size=massive]

On 5 February 2021, locals staged a blockade of NH-37 at Nunga sub-division (coded as Nungba, Tamenglong district, Manipur) to protest against the act of Manipur police 'mistakenly' arresting three Naga youths under the suspicion of involvement in extortion activities. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, AAP leaders and members staged a large protest rally in Mumbai - Dadar (Mumbai City, Maharashtra), against recent increase in fuel prices. [size=large]
Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
On 5 February 2021, military forces of India and Pakistan exchanged fire across the LoC in Sawajian sector area (Poonch district, Jammu and Kashmir). No casualties were inflicted in the incident.
Farmers (India); BKU: Bharatiya Kisan Union; SKM: United Farmers Front; INC: Indian National Congress

On 5 February 2021, farmers from Aam Kisan Union, Rashtriya Kisan Majdoor Mahasangh, BKU and Krantikari Kisan Parivaar Kalyan Sangathan staged a protest for the 3rd day in Harda city (Madhya Pradesh) against centrally passed farm laws. The call for the protest was given by the SKM. The Congress staged a separate protest in the city for the same reason. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, a group of parents staged a protest in Thane city (Maharashtra), over waiver of school fees during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
AAP: Aam Aadmi Party; Government of India (2014-)
On 5 February 2021, an AAP MLA led a protest, in Sangrur (Punjab), against rejection of AAP candidate's nomination allegedly without any reason. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, INC members staged a protest, in Sangrur (Punjab), against an AAP MLA for allegedly misbehaving with the Sub-Divisional Magistrate. [size=no report]

Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), members of many civil bodies staged a sit-in demonstration at Kshetrigao (Manipur) demanding immediate arrest of the people involved in the attack on the sub-deputy commissioner of Noney. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, faculty and non-teaching staff of the Dhanamanjuri University staged a protest at Imphal (Manipur) against the order issued by the Vice Chancellor (VC) in-charge for recruitment of regular faculties and demanded immediate removal of the VC. [size=no report]
MVA: Maha Vikas Aghadi; Shiv Sena

On 5 February 2021, MVA and Shiv Sena members staged protests across Maharashtra including Mumbai city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, teachers and students held a protest in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana) against encroachment of college land. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, MVA members staged protests across Maharashtra including Latur city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, MVA members staged protests across Maharashtra including Kolhapur city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, MVA members staged protests across Maharashtra including Pune city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]
MVA: Maha Vikas Aghadi; Shiv Sena

On 5 February 2021, MVA and Shiv Sena members staged protests across Maharashtra including Aurangabad city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]
MVA: Maha Vikas Aghadi; Shiv Sena

On 5 February 2021, MVA and Shiv Sena members staged protests across Maharashtra including Jalna city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]
MVA: Maha Vikas Aghadi; Shiv Sena

On 5 February 2021, MVA and Shiv Sena members staged protests across Maharashtra including Nagpur city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]
MVA: Maha Vikas Aghadi; Shiv Sena

On 5 February 2021, MVA and Shiv Sena members staged protests across Maharashtra including Thane city (Maharashtra), against increased fuel prices in the state, allegedly caused by inaction by the BJP-led central government. BJP members staged a counter-protest for the same reason, however blamed inaction by the state government to be the cause. [size=no report]

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Jammu and Kashmir with 11 reports followed by Maharashtra with 10 reports.
The largest admin2 is Jammu with 5 reports followed by Imphal East with 2 reports.
The largest admin3 is Jammu with 4 reports followed by Srinagar North with 2 reports.
The largest admin1 is Jammu and Kashmir with 15184 reports followed by Punjab with 10707 reports.
The largest admin2 is Jammu with 3087 reports followed by Srinagar with 2208 reports.
The largest admin3 is Jammu with 2815 reports followed by with 2809 reports.
